alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 2:42PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, Blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. * WHERE...Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine, Fergus County below 4500ft, Hill County, Northern Blaine County and Western and Central Chouteau County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow can significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County
